Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu fingers

vpaBS0gjYDVmox4TKRytcQ.text: Hey! Back at Bean for their delicious tofu scramble.  It's not only good but also a great price.  I'm rating this visit at a 3 today because I'm noticing an annoying trend. Anytime I bring up or point out something undesirable about the meal I just get a bunch of excuses and then finally a sheepish I'm sorry with a hint of "you can leave now". It's so annoying! It's like people these days can't handle any criticism.... guess what.... that's how you get better and surpass all others.  But I guess Bean wants to stay mediocre....well help yourself.  Maybe it will take another Vegan restaurant to show them up...at this rate it won't take much.  Anywho...my rant is over.  The End.

hGRVVkEG05nzw6s_cYwKPA.text: Excellent vegan food!!!!  Highly recommend.  Stopped here on the way uptown to see a show.

jAxu46R1mhsTSWcNA-eYMA.text: This is my favorite plant based food spot in Charlotte. Everything on the menu is delicious! My love (who eats meat) has tried a couple of things that I have eaten from here and he enjoys it as well!  It's a very chill atmosphere, located right off of Independence (if you drive too fast, or blink, you'll miss it), good for takeout (I usually call ahead and it's ready by the time I get there) or a solo lunch! Love this spot!

FkoZW-U382I5AviY5FWVRQ.text: This place is pretty hard to find if you aren't looking for it and you most likely won't stumble upon it by accident mainly because it's literally a hole in the wall on the side of the highway! My dad wanted to get lunch here and I agreed, pretty good choice I must say. It had a mom & pop old diner style feel when you get inside and sit down. There was planets of seating options but not many people actually eating or occupying the space. We were seated right away and given drinks and menus. The menu was pretty wide range for a 100% vegan spot. From soups, to salads, to burgers, to pastas. Usually when I eat out I opt for a salad but since this place was vegan, I new I needed to try a burger because plant based burgers are pretty hard to nail and I thought I could get a True vegan experience. I got the fried pickles as an appetizer, cowboy burger and side of Mac and cheese for my entre. It was honestly phenomenal. Better than any regular burger I've ever had (I don't have them that often anyways). The Mac and cheese was a little d i f f e r e n t i will say, an acquired taste mainly, but still damn good for completely plant based. I will definitely be back and bring my carnivorous boyfriend next time too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cowboy burger, fried pickles, Mac and cheese, and dad
Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States

Hgf8feK5zHDkNz6ZW14E8A.text: Before I arrived at Bean I made sure to read the Yelp reviews and suggestions. So, let's get this out of the way... Service was great, fine, attentive, just right. Some of the service reviews I read here could have been solved by getting off a mighty horse or tuning the eater's attitude a bunch (there are those bad days, though, that any restaurant can have) but tonight was just fine... Next!  As a  non-vegan I like to tip my toes in the genre and explore. This thing called jackfruit blows me away and tucked into a BBQ taco screws with the cerebral synapses... Tres interessant. You have to buy the fried zukes and cauliflower. Sure, there's more oil used here than the Valdez wreck but it's simply delicious.  Yes, I'll be back... The best review that a restaurant can have...

EpH3COpmMN9Kng6NbMA_8Q.text: My Go to for yummy Vegan lunch in a chill atmosphere and family friendly. I stumbled across Bean sometime ago but it took me a minute to review as I wanted to ensure consistency.  This place upon approach could come off as a "Meh" place but once you try the food you will be super pleased. The Bean menu is pretty entail with explanation in detail of the various forms of plant protein mentioned in various dishes.   The kids menu is cute and simple our son has had both options the cheese quesadilla and the Tofu nuggets. He enjoys both very well at the age of 2 and now 3.   My husband and I FAV burger is The Cowboy burger. My husband is more stuck on that burger than I am as I like to try other offerings (he had had that burger all 6-7 visits). I also enjoy the Jalepeno cheddar burger, the Rueben and the veggie quesadilla.  Bonus: You can shop Vegan  after eating at the attached convenience store. The store is stocked with items I order online due to the in availability of them for the most part in stores. I was so happy to see that I can purchase the items here.  Overall I enjoy Bean and the customer service which is hit or miss but when it's MISS there tends to be someone else that notices and try to assist.

H52UuK1leQG12HzQ9hAm8Q.text: Finally had the opportunity to eat at Bean this weekend with my daughter.  We had the Good burger and the King burger with zucchini side and tater tot casserole side.  ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!! Best vegan burger I have ever had and the sides are fresh and very flavorful.   The staff was very nice and the food choices look great.  I will definitely be returning to try more items.

H1sv1bBOQKtQAEU3keXtCg.text: My husband and I visited BEAN on our first date night since having our baby boy (10 months ago!). Unfortunately, I read many negative reviews on various sites regarding the lack of customer service and the area/atmosphere of the restaurant. We almost didn't go because of the comments. We wanted to have a great first night out and for it to be special!   BEAN did not disappoint. At all. We were greeted upon arrival. The waiter was very attentive and we ordered based on his recommendations. We had the fried cauliflower, cowboy burgers, and chocolate cake and it was all absolutely delicious. Several other staff members came by to pick up dishes, ask if we needed anything, and to pick up our check. Everyone was friendly and helpful!   I love that BEAN is not one of those fancy, overly priced snobby vegan restaurants. I don't care about organic kale and stuffed avocados. We eat healthy vegan food at home most of the time. If you want great southern comfort food, you need to go to BEAN!   It REALLY is good, ya'll!

NmfgAU7f8zvGHzsMrIKNgg.text: I really wish there was a half-star option.   Bean gets 2.5 stars from me. The one time I went was a spur-of-the-moment visit. I just happened to be driving by and decided to stop. I am NOT vegan but I enjoy meatless options quite a bit as I was raised by a vegetarian (now vegan) parent.  The young lady who took my order was friendly and the food was good. If I lived on that side of town, I would probably eat here again but it's quite a drive for me.

MB9Fb-jTiOXj028p-G9ywA.text: Ooooohhh you're sneaky Bean. You really are. You fooled me. Okay, you didn't because it's in the name. I know you're a Vegan joint, but you almost fooled me. I mean your cheese tasted like cheese. Your burger had a consistency that made me forget I wasn't eating meat. The fried jalapenos really threw me off. I may just have to become a Vegan.   Sike nah, that's not happening, but I'm seriously considering it, with all the shat they put in food these days.   I'm typically open to eating all types of food and I had good reason to eat at this place with my brother (who is vegan) in town.   That jalapeno burger was extremely delicious. I seriously thought I was eating real cheese. They used Daiya cheese and my brother couldn't believe it. He said he's had the cheese before after purchasing from maybe Whole Foods, and when he opened the package, he said it smelled like fart. No lie.   I don't know what Bean did but they did good.   The crunchy jalapenos was a nice touch and I'm not exactly sure what the patty was made out of but it had similar consistency to a bean burger. I wasn't too thrilled about the fries. Not my style. And the "ranch" was okay but was definitely better after mixing it with the ketchup. I think it just needed more salt.   My brother thoroughly enjoyed his burger. He talked about it all weekend. Like, ALL WEEKEND!   If you're vegan, you'll love this place and if you're not, like me, you'll love this place.

CNtR1t7IhZvJ0eWH-gf5lg.text: the food wasn't good and neither was the service.  Well let me take that back... thankfully they serve the Beyond Meat brand sausage and the pinento cheese was alright but everything else was not good.  Sweet collard greens..  with craisins... like on some whole foods tip??  The fried squash was bland and tasted like squishy grease.  My niece did like her fried pickles tho.   Service was beyond unacceptable....won't ever be dining here again.

v2QcYPc6XXEes4GXIDxE-Q.text: Ok, so I have to admit something. I have driven past this restaurant probably 100 times and never stopped in because it totally looks sketchy!  This being said, I am SO glad that I finally did. As a vegetarian, I was thrilled by the extensive and interesting menu. They have so many options, and many of them are customizable to fit exactly what you are craving. I ended up getting the 'Bean Bowl' with BBQ tofu in it. DELISH!  The only reason that I am not giving it 5 stars is the location and ambiance. It felt a little grungy in there, but once you get past that, you won't regret it.

h8V7LxXjMy_rk1_zGxFFQA.text: I am really sad. The Bean used to be my favorite, we always received good service and the food was excellent vegan comfort food. I returned today for the first time in two years and everything was just poorer quality. The service was atrocious, a first for us at Bean. We were forgotten about, not receiving a single refill on our drinks, after it took more than fifteen minutes for us to receive them initially when we ordered. Our food took forever, and our waiter never checked in on us, we had to flag him down just to get the check.  As for our meal, I got the cheesesteak, it bun was not as good, less seitan and it was smaller than it used to be. My husband got the jalapeno burger, which barely had any jalapenos. They are using a different ranch dressing which was flavorless and flat. We had really high hopes given the years of good service and delicious food we had gotten in previous years, before our move, but we were absolutely disappointed, especially considering it is over an hour's drive to get there for us now. Definitely will not be going back given other reviewers have also complained about awful service, which was the biggest issue for us.

LlZQv6odZRcZX3gmH0Z9Rg.text: I love this place! It's a diamond in the rough kind of spot! And their Ruben sandwich is LEGITTTTT!

48haBQgkekS6ApbQ_B30QA.text: I'm giving 1 star bc the customer service sucks so damn badly.  My niece brought me here once and I was very impressed with how good the food was but thought the server was less than nice or welcoming.  When we would thank her for dropping the food and drinks to the table, we never got a "your welcome", we got a sort of Acknowledgment "groan" or "mmm hmm".   I came back with the hopes of enjoying the food and was greeted with a "you have takeout or want dine-in"...no "hello" (and the hostess which needs some classes in customer service relations) slapped menus on a table, and walked away.  What happened to "enjoy your meal", "someone will be right with you"??  We sat there for close to 10 minutes without being greeted so got up and left.  It's a small place and no more than 7 or 8 tables were in there at that time so don't know why we weren't greeted.   Will never return.......

_K25jaQ4l722GvM6GpU9_w.text: The Diablo burger was superb. We went here TWICE while we were in town and I also enjoyed the fake meatloaf they had. I really like the mac and cheese, and I was impressed with their mashed potatoes and gravy.  I think I saw the server twice while we were there the second time, we had to get up from the table multiple times to request things like refills on our drinks, or ketchup. Maybe she didnt care since they forced 18% tip on our table no matter what.

McBnZrEll_SviLu9j1hRTA.text: The customer service kinda sucks ..in my opinion maybe it was late and they were tired .. not sure  But it's hey have really good ice cream shakes lol .   My food wasn't all that great . I ordered southern style cauliflower bites I asked if it was seasoned the batter was bland . My mate ordered the philly , it was better

9R2kb7tCDIMcDO7NtFkV5w.text: The best BBQ jackfruit sandwich. A must-have if you're in the mood for a pulled pork inspired sandwich.

jHzt600Fe78uhn5ueAcPEA.text: I was really looking forward to trying this place but was very disappointed.  One of the friends I was with and I ordered the jackfruit tacos without the green sauce on top. Both of ours came with it. I decided to just eat it as is but she sent it back as she can't handle much spice. When they came back without the sauce, she couldn't eat them because they were extremely bland. I agreed and without the green sauce, I don't think I could have eaten them either. Despite not being able to eat them, she was still forced to pay for the tacos.  The service is really what let me down. Apart from the person who took our order, no one checked on us. We had to catch their eye any time we needed something despite it not being especially busy. They forgot my friend's smoothie and cheesecake.  The prices were definitely too high for the quality of the food in my opinion.  I do hope things change in the future because this could be a wonderful place. For now, I won't be going back.

swUg3JYYioMec5oePTVSsA.text: The food is typically good, but the service has been terrible at times.  I don't typically leave bad reviews, but the most recent visit irritated me enough to feel the need to leave one.    This most recent visit was with my girlfriend on my birthday.  Everything was fine when being seated and ordering our drinks and food.  After ordering our food, we received our appetizer fine.  Shortly after, a different waitress came with my girlfriend's food, sat it down and then kind of gave me a questioning look and asked if I had ordered something too.  I told her yes, and she went back to the order/computer, where are original waitress already was.  I could hear them talking, and heard "..... was going on, so I completely forgot to put it in....".  Hey, ok, cool -- that happens, not a big deal.    Well, while my girlfriend started eating, I waited for about 10 minutes and my original waitress still had not come over to let us know what had happened.  The waitress that had brought over our food eventually came by the table, told us what happened and apologized.    Eventually my food had finally came out, albeit missing the side of ranch that I had ordered along with it.  I told the waitress, and she ran back to the kitchen area, presumably to get the ranch.  I start eating my burger, and hold off for a couple minutes for my side of ranch for the fries.  Well, another 5 or so minutes pass, so I said fine, and just started eating my fries as well.  I had complete time to finish my meal, pack the rest of my girlfriend's food in a to-go box, and get the check from the waitress that had originally dropped off our food.    As I was filling in the check, the original waitress comes over with a side of ranch in a plastic cup, and kind of looks around befuddled as to what I need the ranch for since.  I said that yeah, it took too long, I'm done eating and don't need the ranch anymore. She kind of got snippy and said "well, we already put it in the cup so let me get you a lid to take it home because it's already on your check".  So she ran off to get the lid I guess, and when she came back I told her that the ranch had taken 10 minutes to get, after i had finally received my food, which was after I had watched my girlfriend eat, because she forgot to put the order in and not even have the courtesy to tell us, and you still expect me to pay for the ranch?    She gave some mumblings about how the kitchen was busy and blah blah blah, and didn't take it off the check and gave us a "you still have to pay for it" kind of attitude.  Ok, so let me get this straight -- you forgot to put in my order, didn't tell us that you forgot to put in my order, the food finally comes WITHOUT the ranch that I had ordered, and you send a simple side of ranch to the BEGINNING of the kitchen line instead of telling the kitchen that you need it rushed for an already late order?  Either way, I gave the first $0 tip in my life and left the ranch.  This entire situation would have been fine and we would have left happy if just two things had happened...  1. Told us what had happened with my order.  Since I overheard her talking, I knew what had happened, but she didn't know that.  Have the courtesy to come to the table, explain and apologize.   2. If you had forgotten the ranch for my already late order, go back have the kitchen rush it.  Seriously, this isn't that hard of a concept and it's how things always seem to be done at every other restaurant I've ever been to.  But ok, you didn't do that.  Cool.  Even not having the ranch for my meal wasn't that big of a deal.  But after it arrived 10-15 minutes later, you should have apologized (again?) and be proactive and take it off the check.  So look, the food is good when you're in the mood for greasy vegan soul food.  I've had some issues with the service, with this one being the worst.  I have seen numerous mentions of many others having issues with the service as well.  After this one though, I definitely won't be returning and instead will go to the many other killer vegan options in CLT.  (Thank you to the waitress that was actually helpful during this visit!)

72aba4OW8VPE_gq7cXkQJQ.text: This place has delicious dishes that are hard to find at other vegan restaurants. I love how they recreate meat dishes in a vegan way like the Reuban sandwich... So good! A lot of food is fried and it isn't all healthy vegan food but it is southern inspired. I usually get food to go as the restaurant itself isn't a dining experience at all.   Staff can be hit or miss, friendly or rude, I guess it depends on the day!

Vu063MPnuvduWYf7Ms7MGA.text: I just had the worst dining experience that I have had in many many years.  And the service was creepy in that the wait people/manager were smiling throughout.   I ordered vegan bratwurst (mediocre at best) and a side of fried squash.  The squash was mush and I told the waitress that I wanted to exchange it for another side.   She looked worried and mumbled that she would ask the manager.  She shortly came back smiling and  said "No, we can't do that".  I said ok assuming they're undercapitalized.  She later asked if I wanted to box the squash.  Very irritating.  Then the manager came over and asked if we needed anything else,smiling weirdly.  When we said no, he said "well we need your table", again smiling oddly.   We left stating we would not be back.  He smiled and said "that's ok".     Once more, the food was mediocre to bad and the management is abominable.

JXx7HPcU1j8jn4c9sfjaQA.text: Visiting as a result of Hurricane Irma. As traveling vegans it can get a little tough to find a good spot. This place was sooooo good. I had the buffalo cauliflower and the cowboy burger. Definitely come check this place out!

8RBjnchRupLAYS0SRTwrzg.text: My girlfriend and I being (and becoming) devoted vegetarians, we definitely wanted to try this place, and it did not stay on our list long before we ended up going there.  The outside, as my girlfriend had mentioned in the past, does not look like anything special for sure (it has a dull brown color and is right on the side of a large, fast-moving road.  They do say location is everything, but at the same time, you cannot always be as lucky as you wish to be in picking a spot for your establishment.  Walking into this place, there was a little bit of a weird vibe, but nothing we could not handle (we are all weird in our own ways).  I guess the owner of this place really likes superheroes and such, because there is memorabilia everywhere, on every surface.  Needless to say, it felt pretty weird sitting there with all of the figurines next to us, without much of an explanation from the owner (they could have come around and explained it, and I would have been much more interested).  I am not a stickler for professionalism by any means, but everyone in this place was wearing whatever they wanted to, and our server had the brightest white frames on his glasses, making it hard to really take much of the experience seriously.  For the fact that there were not many tables in this establishment, I thought that the service was relatively slow (contrary to when I had called a couple of weeks before and the person on the other end of the phone had said that they turn over tables pretty quickly).  Again, there was ample time for someone to come by and explain the place, its mission, why it looked the way it looked, etc.  I am pretty sure that I saw (who I thought was) the owner talking to a bunch of other parties, but we hardly saw him.  The server seemed a little delayed when we ordered the food, like he was unsure of what we were ordering or something.  We had a priority, which was figuring out what did and did not have nuts in it, for my girlfriend is allergic to them, and that would have instantly been a deal-breaker.  First, our server did not have much to say about it, and suggested we just order and go from there (not the worst suggestion ever, as it is what I may say where I work as well).  Who we thought to be the owner also came over, but his help was even less reassuring ("yeah guys, we do use peanuts..." not "how can I make sure you enjoy my business as well as everyone else?").  The food we ended up ordering was pretty great, I wold have to say.  For being vegan, it is pretty impressive that they could pull off a flavorful cowboy burger, barbecue chicken fingers, and fried pickles (although they left a lot to be desired, and the portion was HUGE).  The food was exactly how it looked on the website, which was helpful and satisfying, and the taste really was great.  In being consistent with the rest of the reviews I have done, I have given this establishment this rating based mostly upon their food quality, but there is much to be said about the service.  It definitely made the mood difficult to explain at best.  I am also attributing at least some of the mood to the fact that we may have been in a little bit of a sour mood while we were there.  Thus, I have tried to be as objective as possible in writing this review, but I do not know if we will be going back.  Although we ordered a lot to try (exactly how I wanted it), the food definitely costs a fair amount, and I cannot say right now if it is worth it for us to return.

bkYfDjk5EEcOyjxW_CjgMQ.text: Let me start by saying I LOVE the food at Bean. Despite the restaurants slightly lackluster appearance, the food is absolutely incredible. It's a vegan southern comfort food heaven, and it's such an awesome thing to go into a restaurant and not worry if what I'm eating is actually vegan. I haven't tried a menu item that I didn't love, and it is one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. Highly recommend any of the burgers, the BBQ jackfruit sandwich, the chips and queso, the pimento cheese, the bean bowl, and the tofu fingers! However the customer service is the reason I'm giving this restaurant a 3 star rating. There are a few regular servers who are amazing and very sweet, but bean staff need a briefing on dealing with customers ASAP.    When eating in the restaurant, expect to be there for 1.5 to 2 hours. Usually the wait for a table is excessive due to the consistent understaffing. Several times I've come in, only to wait 30-45 minutes for a table (mind, this is while there are several tables open, just not enough servers) then 45 minutes to an hour for food. Don't try to eat here on a Saturday, there are usually only one or two servers working the whole restaurant and service is unbearably slow, not through any fault of the wait staff. However its fairly common for water or drinks to be sitting empty and not refilled in a timely manner, and several staff over the past few years have been rude and inattentive.   When ordering take out, there is usually an issue. Once a staff member forgot to put our order in the system so we had to wait an additional 20 minutes for our food after called 30 minutes previously. We have also called before and the phone has been off the hook for over 30 minutes due to staff negligence. At one point we had placed a to-go order and after waiting almost an hour, my husband asked the manager who was at the counter politely how much longer it would be. He received a rude and aggressive response in turn. Our order has been put into the system wrong on several occasions and we have had to wait for it to be fixed. The "pickup time" is always 10-15 minutes, even on a night when they're slammed, but you'll still have to wait longer than that for your food.  None of these issues have been rectified in any way other than an apology. We have never received a discount for a long wait, never offered something in return for our food being forgotten, or never even offered a drink while we wait over 20 minutes for food. We at one point asked if we could have a discount or a complimentary dish due to the excessive wait time, but were told that staff didn't have the authority to do so, only managers (none were in the store at that time).  All of these issues don't outweigh the deliciousness of the food for us, at least not yet. We continue to eat at Bean because of the quality of the food, and the few staff members there that are friendly. However the customer service desperately need improvement. There is a large employee turnover rate, no repercussions we have seen for poor service, no emphasis on customer service, and we believe it comes down to management. We have eaten at the Bean Vegan Cuisine in Asheville several times and have never had an issue. The staff at that location have always been friendly, the service quick and efficient, and the restaurant well maintained. We would hate for such a wonderful local vegan spot to get a bad reputation and suffer for such an easily fixed issue. Management - please take this review seriously, as it comes from a loyal Bean customer who wants you to succeed but is very close to giving up completely.

jEleWKjn1cuTI-OGveLdlA.text: Yummy vegan food (try the cowboy burger and the tofu fingers) in a casual setting decorated with comic book covers, Star Wars art, and action figures. The only downside is that service can be a little slow and it might feel like your food takes forever -- but keep in mind that the wait means your food is being prepared as ordered and will be fresh. Still, the wait is killer when you're hungry. Good place for kids -- they even tape up their artwork on a wall in the waiting area!

jT6hD_knWM8z8lCniMdB1A.text: I always have a good meal here! Definitely try the bacon cheeseburger and the tater tot casserole! The best burger in Charlotte!

e0CkEEqmzDnREewP3qsYGw.text: Terrible management. The owner was awful and a bigot. Place was FILTHY. The food was a joke for a vegan restaurant . EVERYTHING is fried. I would have enjoyed eating at a Waffle House more. Good luck keeping this place open.

gyF-43bHn_XPEnaJyZucWQ.text: I find that one of the most difficult things about turning vegan is worrying what you'll be able to eat and if it'll taste good. I've been vegan for a little more than a year and have been eating here for the same time frame. This restaurant has the BEST food. I usually always end up eating the Jalapeno Cheddar burger because it's soooooo good, their chorizo dip is delicious too. The atmosphere is comfortable and relaxing, they have music playing in the background at just the right volume. They also have an attached mini store next to the restaurant giving you access to vegan foods to take home with you. I've been there about 10 times with my friends and boyfriend, some are vegan some aren't but we can all agree the food is delicious. My absolute favorite restaurant in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jalapeño Cheddar Burger

lamCLlQ5ijVO_LRrnx_LVA.text: Since my last rating, I tried Bean again. Looks like they have updated the menu somewhat and I had a really good BBQ jackfruit sandwich with a side of collards. Service was a little lackluster, but nothing that couldn't be overlooked. The decor is extremely dated

NKH9sSMvtEWUuCI7fBG2fQ.text: My favorite thing on their menu is the Buffalo fingers and waffles.  This restaurant isn't a "healthy" vegan spot, but it's pure vegan. I would recommend calling in your order.  However, i gave them 3 stars because the service is slow & careless and the environment isn't really welcoming.

PtearHy5tOM_bBJwETkBQQ.text: I really enjoyed the Philly cheese hoagie and mac 'n' cheese side. Both were flavorful and hearty portions. I was able to take some home for a second meal which is a plus. Also, the buffalo cauliflower was amazing! I enjoyed everything including the customer service. I wish this restaurant will have much success in Charlotte.

n0uIkDnLrNRAKSLfMkv-ZA.text: So, I will admit that I am a vegan and that I've never actually gone inside of Bean Vegan Cuisine. I'm a university student and we're not allowed to have cars on campus so I usually rely on delivery. That being said, I've gotten food delivered from there twice. The first time, I got the cheeseburger thing alongside Mac and cheese, gravy, and the raspberry cake. I loved both of my sides and the cake but the burger just wasn't my style or what I was expecting. The second time around, I got their make your own scramble where I added sausage, cheese, and mushrooms and it actually wasn't that bad though admittedly I wish they used another brand rather than daiya cheese and the sausage was pretty spicy. I also ordered for dinner as well, because today was just one of those days where I didn't want to go to the cafeteria and got their tofu fingers combo where I got to choose two sides and I actually really liked that. I will continue going back for their desserts, especially when I am in a sweet mood but I will avoid their burgers in the future. I LOVE THAT THEY ARE ALL VEGAN THOUGH, the fact that I don't have to worry and triple check that it's vegan and that everything is fine is such a stress relief and I love it so much.

_4gEpAZpi1876HMNTOSLkQ.text: Awful service. Our food came out cold, an hour after we ordered, and we never received our sides until we were ready to leave. The management and waiter didn't acknowledge our bad service, or complement the bad experience. Will never eat here again.

eXXdpvX-F7Da13HTWCyIuA.text: Decent service.   Pretty unenjoyable burgers.  If you're into the veggie burger/soy fake taste you'll like it. I was looking for a fresh tasting black bean style burger. To each their own. Mash & gravy wasn't great either.   Won't be coming back.

i-kYyYGYjs3lDufKSkkOqA.text: I have eaten here a few times and EVERYTHING I have tried is phenomenal. When I first switched to a vegan lifestyle I had not yet rid of my connection to comfort foods, so Bean helped to fulfill my cravings. I have gone here with non-vegan friends and all of them have enjoyed the food.

aSSgOP8f3IvHfswzCFV30Q.text: WHAT VEGAN DREAMS ARE MADE OF. I relocated from the west coast and have not had vegan food like this out there. I first ate at the Asheville location and this one is just as amazing. I could go on and on about the menu but I shall let my photos speak for themselves. Secondly, I'm so impressed that I got to see/meet the actual owners at each location and hear how passionate they are about their business and the glorious food. Thirdly, you can order one of their whole layered cakes which is literally the best tasting cake I've ever had...it's serious stuff. (I got the chocolate one for my sisters birthday. It was a hit with all the vegans and skeptical non vegans muaha!)

8-frPHKare9_RhoDDWsbzg.text: Bean may not look the part from the outside but the food and menu selection is great if you're vegan. Even if you're not you can enjoy a ton of menu items without missing a beat. I've now visited three times and only once was there an issue. My wife had a hair in her wrap and although we understand that happens sometimes, it shouldn't. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, however unless otherwise burned again I will continue to eat here when I am in the area. The market is awesome as well for some hard to find vegan ingredients. Definitely worth checking out.

Rb55u_8_GEy_Zo76Qrlkhg.text: Amazing staff, amazing food, amazing store.  I highly recommend their mustard soy curls, I dream about them back in Jersey lol  They are also the only store I have ever been to that had vegan dupe candy bars. Just because I'm vegan doesn't mean I don't want milky way and Twix bars haha  Thank God for Bean Vegan Cuisine. I'm down in Charlotte a lot for business and I always make it a point to stop in!  Thanks for being awesome!

nsoBuvBdvtb7zxEHOo3KUw.text: The customer service was horrible but I knew I what I was up against from looking at the reviews. I'm new here and trying to experience new things so I can be a vegan the food was ok but the cauliflower bites were awesome. But I cannot get over the lady there who was very rude.

YjLytjVKzF87eKRgzWzo1g.text: I would say they have turned this place around. The food is much better and I think they have worked out the kinks

1I-d0h6WspZiwWxlpH1Oxw.text: FINALLY was able to stop here after hearing so many great things. I was very impressed with the presentation and overall taste of my food. The bowl was awesome... especially the cauliflower! It is definitely very rice heavy versus a combination of veggies and rice but I enjoyed it all!   I got my order to-go but there is plenty of seating inside to dine-in. There is a small area by the register where you can purchase a variety of vegan/vegetarian foods such as pasta sauce, cookies, candies, Jerky, and more! If you are in the area or have the opportunity to go I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Fried Cauliflower BEAN Bowl

SFlSYXs9ha0kM-F1Gm8S1A.text: Bean Vegan Cuisine doesn't look appetizing from the building but it's just the opposite. I'm not vegan but I know a lot about alternative options for meat, dairy, etc. I ordered the pulled jackfruit bbq sandwich with fries. The jackfruit wasn't quite cooked like I've had it before (dried & then rehydrated). That was honestly the only thing that threw me off guard. There were some pieces that weren't fully pulled which were probably the parts that threw me off guard. I'll know to ask for it cooked a little longer on my next visit (oh im going back for sure!). They also have a section in the restaurant that's like a mini market when you first walk-in. You can pick up a few groceries while you wait on your meal.   Other than that, my experience here was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Close up of the pulled jackfruit bbq
Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled jackfruit bbq sandwich and fries
Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Specials from June

BBmNJcE3AvLfobNV0TRzCw.text: I am not vegan but my sister is vegetarian and is a regular here at Bean. I've tried a handful of vegan restaurants in my life and by far Bean is one of the top. Obviously I'm not a vegan so I may not be the best judge of vegan cuisine but I felt that Bean did a great job with imitation meats, cheese, butter and all around non vegan items. I've been here a few times and the service is always friendly and the food is always fresh and up to par.  To start, we ordered Fried Tofu Fingers as an appetizer with Teriyaki flavor on one side and the Korean BBQ flavor on the other along with ranch dipping sauce. It came with celery as well. The Fried Tofu Fingers were the best part of the meal!! My sister who has tried most of the menu as a regular also believes the fried tofu fingers to be the best thing on the entire menu. She also believes that the tofu finger sandwich is the best entree. The teriyaki flavoring for the fried tofu fingers was our personal favorite and had a perfect balance of savory and sweet. The korean BBQ is also decently flavorful and the ranch dipping sauce balanced the entire appetizer. Their ranch is also better than any other restaurant's ranch that I've had. You usually don't hear from meat eaters like me proclaiming the best ranch is actually vegan ranch but I stand by this 100%. They also sell their ranch in the front area in packets so you can use it at home since it's actually made in house.     I ordered The Cheesesteak Hoagie for $11.99 which was a good price for how big and filling the hoagie is. The hoagie is loaded with (fake) cheese and veggies and tasty sauces which I loved. It's exactly what you would expect out of a good, hearty cheesesteak hoagie. While the cheesesteak hoagie did not disappoint, my personal favorite from their menu will always be their Cowboy Burger at $12.99.   My sister enjoyed the Bacon Cheeseburger as well but she prefers the Jalapeno Cheddar Burger the most, along with the tofu finger sandwich.   Overall Bean has lots of good options and variety if you're looking for some Vegan burgers and sandwiches. From the ones I've tried, they've never disappointed and it's honestly super super impressive that it's actually vegan because it does taste JUST LIKE REAL MEAT. Honestly the awful drive on the side of the freeway is worth it for some good vegan comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Tofu Fingers with celery and ranch dipping sauce. (Left side is teriyaki sauce tofu + right side is korean BBQ tofu)

ziq6qD9mCi3ZW-ZjN4ZvGw.text: Great vegan place! So good I went here twice when I was in Charlotte. The first time I went for breakfast and got the BBQ grit bowl which is also gluten free. This was one of the most delicious and filling vegan, gluten free breakfasts I've had. It consisted of these delicious BBQ soy curls over cheesy grits with kale and a corn muffin. The soy curls had a nice texture to go with the creamy grits which you could not tell had vegan cheese. This was super filling I could only eat about half of it. I enjoyed the breakfast so much I decided to come again for dinner. I got the jalapeno cheddar burger since I love vegan burgers and spice. The burger patty was good but not anything special. I did love the toppings which included vegan cheddar cheese and fried jalapeno chips. Will definitely come back if I'm in Charlotte again.

UM5BQW0RdyxyV97taDzBAw.text: I love this place!  I'm new to Charlotte and feared not having a vegan spot to go to only to find out I was wrong.  This is one of my new favorite places!  I've been at 7 times now trying anything from brunch to dinner.  I love the flavors used for the bowls, the burgers, and my waffle and tater tots was great.  If you're looking for vegan comfort foods with a southern influence look no further.  Saturday's are packed so be warned. Bon apetit!

UwYLo6BJErW4rC7B6oAbNw.text: Food was good, price was good, it's Vegan or vegetarian, but it's actually really good. Two issues, decor could use updating, and our waitress had a bad attitude, tattoos and all, I think she rebelling against society and takes it out on her customers. If the service was better I would be giving it 5 stars.

CxjJE1ZA4rXeer0Fyal60w.text: Awesome no frills vegan restaurant with really good and filling food and dairy free soft serve and milkshakes. The menu has a lot of different and unique options and a bunch of different takes on vegan burgers that are filling and have great texture (would easily fool any meat eater!). The cookies and cream milkshake is delicious. I had the old fashioned cheeseburger with chili on it and it was filling and delicious. The bean bowl with any style of cauliflower or tofu strips is also a good combo of healthy and filling! This is the kind of place to try out if you're intimidated by eating vegan!

Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bean bowl with southern style cauliflower

v0pke5HFE99N0YKOGkQb6g.text: Not sure if it is servers assigned because our server barely came to check on us . We order a app the 'Crabbie dip' it was flavorless so we asked could it be sent back and the server said 'We only replace sides' we didnt want  a replacement because our food had made it . When I mentioned to manager he said to refer back to server he was more concerned about who was watching tv that worked there . Not going back it blew me .

photos.caption: Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. The &#34;Crabbie Dip&#34; no flavor what so ever bland

LI8X5tKrd1xh2ASuhTqtDg.text: My vegan daughter loves this place, and she finally got me there for lunch! I'm vegetarian, and I eat vegan a lot. She claims everything on the menu is delicious, but most importantly, EVERYTHING is vegan. Well, between us today we tried 6 different menu items, and all were great! I don't love vegan Mac and cheese, but she does. Everything else was just wonderful. They serve soy based ice cream and shakes, incredible! We didn't have great service, it was adequate, but the food is such a treat we didn't mind. I have a feeling I'll be taking her there many more times while she lives in Charlotte!

Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried buffalo tofu sandwich, tator tot casserole. Both are 12x better than they look.

VfuKuaVQEDeUhXlw7gsEOg.text: I had the philly cheese steak and the fried pickles. Both were tasty and filling. We also had the crabby dip as an appetizer. This was not as good. It was very Mayo- substitute heavy and the crab alternative was  not comparable. Overall though the food was good. The service was a little slow, but that may be because the waiters were understaffed. The location was less than ideal including the decor.

xSknCCIVqLP9jI7sOnKo8g.text: DISCLAIMER ***Neither myself or my husband are Vegans.   My husband and I are always down to try new things and create new experiences. This was an interesting one for us. My husband eats ALL kinds of food. I only eat chicken and mostly vegetarian products. We have heard lots of our friends and clients talk about this establishment so we figured we would give it a try.   The restaurant is extremely decorative on the inside. Very cute. The staff was welcoming and we were never rushed when we would tell our waiter that we need more time to look over their menu.   I ordered the bacon cheeseburger with fried squash. My husband ordered the Ruben sandwich with a side of greens.   We both loved our sides! The fried squash was amazing and my husband ate the greens so quickly I couldn't even try them. We how ever did not like the sandwiches. It was not for us.   I have been trying to figure out how to write a review for this place. Nothing went wrong. Our experience was fun. The staff was nice. The restaurant was clean and relaxing. Everyone seemed to be enjoying there food. Lots of smiles all around.   I didn't want to bash a place because we didn't like the TYPE of food they provided. We KNEW going in that it was VEGAN. We knew it would be hit or miss... I didn't think it would be fair to give low stars because that's not how it's done.   Thank you for the experience Vegan Bean.

photos.caption: Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States

Swo5PR9hPFihg4L0mMoiYA.text: I've been to the Charlotte Bean location twice, both times for brunch. The brunch bowl is great if it's your first time there for brunch because it has a little bit of everything. Think tofu scramble, potatoes, grits, carrot bacon, and a biscuit. The Herc bowl is more savory and at first glance doesn't seem like a breakfast-brunchy type of dish - bbq soy curls, spicy mayo, and kale? But oh my goodness, it's so good! I also get extra carrot bacon on the side because I'm obsessed with it.   The service has been perfectly adequate but nothing to write home about. The building itself seems a little dinghy and like it hasn't been well cared for. For example, the floor is quite sticky when you walk in. For me, this is what keeps this review from 5 stars.   That being said, I love Bean and plan on returning every time I'm in Charlotte.

Hb8xkXQNAvlFj1-6dfUjKQ.text: The Service and Servers get poorer every time I drop in. I ordered my usual burger and onion rings and wanted to swap my lettuce for kale. This young lady decides to tell me that she'll have to charge it as a side $4.49 for a fucking piece of kale. I informed her that I've never paid that price for subbing. Never again will I come to this place, I'll stick to Val-Tree.

nop3IhuR04VX2T4M8yDzDw.text: This was my second visit to popular vegan spot simply known as "Bean." The service was remarkably the same - helpful and patient.  I ordered the buffalo cauliflower to start - delicious. A little oily for my taste, I think the batter-to-buffalo sauce ratio needs some tweaking. But the real winner was the "queso dip." Holy guacamole!! Amazing, and filling. Would have paired well with the "quesadilla," which is also supposed to be a fan favorite.   Overall, a great experience!

qcISFbIzY-lU143kumfm2w.text: Always really good fresh food. Love the crabbie patty sandwich and salad. The fried cauliflower is amazing!!! Always greeted nicely by staff. So many options makes being or wanting to be vegan a tasty treat

dIet_B28klZdiuJAbPntcw.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting Charlotte and decided to try this place. I'm so glad we did! It's a neat little joint that even sells vegan food, snacks, and merch. The service was quick and the workers were friendly. My boyfriend ordered the Reuben with onion rings, and I ordered the cheesesteak hoagie with the tater tot casserole. We tried each other's dishes and everything was so delicious. I think anyone, vegan or not, should have an open mind and try this place out. I think you may like it! Also, I'd like to add that for being a vegan restaurant, the prices weren't outrageous. I'd go back for sure!

F_i-z07_LrocxJxm7HXahA.text: Vegan comfort food with GF options.  Options include burgers, tacos, tofu fingers and more!  I had the cheesesteak hoagie with a side of macaroni.  It was so delicious and filling!  My fiance had a cowboy burger with tater tot casserole and our little one had a quesadilla with fries.  We took a vanilla milkshake to go.  It's not easy to find vegan options like this!  They also have vegan products for sale, making it super easy to grab the necessities!  We will definitely be back!!!

I-oPVbpGNgcTmSg1oLg5UA.text: The first time I went here the server was great and the food was a little on the bland side. I decided to give them another chance and boy was the food amazing! I got the Bacon Cheeseburger, it did not taste like bacon but it was super sloppy just like when I used to eat meat. The Queso was amazing and so was the fried BBQ cauliflower! The only down side was the server was in a rush because she was serving everyone in the restaurant. I spent $50 and we got 2 meals with sides and 2 appetizers. They could definitely use a second server in the restaurant, or keep only server focusing on customers so we don't feel neglected and rushed. Definitely one of the better tasting vegan restaurants in Charlotte.

Z-ruCRA6KTMlS0U46xrkog.text: Bean is awesome, especially if you're craving vegan bar/fried food. The portions are awesome. Good luck trying to eat that many fried pickles (a perfect challenge to have). My partner absolutely loves the Rueben. The fried tofu fingers are good, but I personally prefer a meat substitute like tempeh to really soak up the wing sauce flavor throughout. The only recommendation I have is for a makeover of the actual space, which looks like an old abandoned Italian restaurant.

DENqpCSEVF_qTKPr6Lmirw.text: The owner of this establishment was extremely rude, disrespectful, and combative. I have never been spoke to in such a way in my whole life. He has 0% customer service skills. His reaction to a dish not being up to par was out right outrageous. He treats his employees very poorly as well.  This was the most unpleasant experience. Needless to say I will Never be returning! I advised anyone that's considering dining at this restaurant to think twice.

R377YdahPl7wGiIoRhcxgQ.text: Pretty good for no meat, I know that isn't the most shining overview but it is Vegan. If you're into that lifestyle you will love all the choices. Now, the fishless fish tacos made with Jack Fruit is outstanding and if anyone wants to give a go I will gladly return for those bad boys. Navy Beans with rosemary is spot on also. The tatter tot casserole is a liar and in no way represents tatter tots. All and all "Eh" is the best I can give at this point. Not the cheapest place either but keep in mind they're making meat replacements with other foods some of which is exotic so...

Nopeg5nibW0vLp_zT4dovw.text: Sorry. Cannot recommend. Call me Yanks or whatever but Southern Food DOES NOT all have to be greasy fatty fried food! Gees, I begged my family to take me to this place for Mother's Day, not sure what I was thinking. But as the "foodie" and vegan that I am, I really wanted to give it a try. Especially with that awesome name!!! Unfortunately, we were all so disappointed! We ordered around 5 different dishes. They all were super greasy, they were all soaked in heavy sauces of vegan cheeses and creams, their vegan burger left much to desire and think about. Not sure what vegan cheese brand they use but the American cheese flavor in the burger had such an off taste and there was a weird sweet taste to the burger. The rice and bean dish was also disappointing, the beans tasted like they were straight poured from a can. The fried pickles were super super super soaked in grease and they were spicy hot which caught us by surprise. Now as I am super fair, one thing we loved was how nice they all were! I didn't have the heart to complaint at the moment (nor wanted to completely ruin Mother's Day), so we just let it passed and as it was my first visit on a busy holiday I give them the benefit of doubt. I am still open for maybe a second visit, yes that's the mercy in me not my mind side. I simply cannot believe they have such poor quality and still keep open and busy. Oh one last thing, the cleanness of the place in overall left much to desire. I'm all earthy, kind of granola hippie friendly, but if you're a female waiter and choose to leave your underarm hair grow (or even a male) please do NoT crop your T-shirt and expose your hairy underarm while serving and reaching plates over a table! That's just common sense... just saying. Hoping to have another type of review next time around. I am going to give them a chance!

NO13QNNKKO4eN9DoDFbdwQ.text: Very cool menu.  I've tried the famous Cowboy burger and tonight the Roasted Portabella Bean Bowl. Both were excellent.  $4 house wine was not bad. I have to recommend this place for vegan meals.  Right across Independence Blvd from Ovens Auditorium.

photos.caption: Photo of Bean Vegan Cuisine - Charlotte, NC, United States. Portabella Bean Bowl

cku4n4d1HDinrK9UWKr8yw.text: Burgers, salads, homestyle meals, appetizers, and desserts. Mouth-watering yet? It is all vegan cuisine! Take it from a non-vegan, the food is delish. You'll forget you're eating vegan cuisine. Great food, service, and prices aren't that bad. Overall, a great place for vegans and non-vegans alike. Read my detailed review at voyagingfork.com
